thread.title: Earl Vaughan Jr.'s prep football picks: Week 7
thread.title_full: Earl Vaughan Jr.'s prep football picks: Week 7

title: Earl Vaughan Jr.'s prep football picks: Week 7
text:
Earl Vaughan Jr.'s prep football picks: Week 7 
I’ve seen the question posed on Facebook and Twitter the last week or so, so I’ll ask and answer it here. 
Just when did we start postponing high school football games because of rain? Well, since the revenue from those gate receipts became the key source of income for the entire athletic program. Prep football pays the way for just about every other sport played during the school year. 
There are some that make a little extra cash for the athletic program, but the one that consistently generates the bulk of the dollars is football. 
Things have changed a lot from the time when I went to school at Swain County and West Rowan; that is, there are far more ways to have fun in a safe and dry environment on Friday night instead of sitting under an umbrella in a football stadium. 
That’s why they move them. They are scraping for every nickel they can get. 
The rain was good for my picking last week. I went 21-3 to put the total for the year at 119-32, 78.8 percent. 
Seventy-First at South View 
The Falcons should quickly return to the win column. Seventy-First 35, South View 12 
Gray’s Creek at Westover 
The Wolverines put up a tough fight before losing to Terry Sanford. I expect them to again tonight. Gray’s Creek 31, Westover 20 
Union Pines at Terry Sanford 
This should be another relatively easy one for the Bulldogs. Terry Sanford 39, Union Pines 8 
Pine Forest at Jack Britt 
Pine Forest has quickly become the hardest team for me to figure out this year. Let’s give it one more try. Jack Britt 28, Pine Forest 14 
Lee County at Douglas Byrd 
The suffering continues for Byrd. Lee County 22, Douglas Byrd 7 
Overhills at Cape Fear 
Lots of potential to get this one wrong. Cape Fear is coming back from a week off. There’s also the rain. I say, let common sense rule. Cape Fear 28, Overhills 21 
OTHER GAMES Garner 32, Harnett Central 6 Southern Lee 34, Triton 7 Whiteville 22, Fairmont 14 Red Springs 28, East Columbus 12 South Columbus 27, West Columbus 10 St. Pauls 22, South Robeson 6 Midway 29, Pender 8 Wallace-Rose Hill 29, West Bladen 6 Union 24, Rocky Point Trask 12 Spring Creek 20, Hobbton 18 Lakewood 27, North Duplin 8 North Moore 24, South Davidson 6 Wake Christian 39, Harrells Christian 12 Concord First Assembly 23, Village Christian 12 
Scholastic sports editor Earl Vaughan Jr. can be reached at vaughane@fayobserver.com or 486-3519.
